extendedIngredients.name: maple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Tbsp + 1/2 tsp Pure maple syrup, divided (or to taste)

extendedIngredients.name: pumpkin pie spice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 tsp Pumpkin pie spice + additional for garnish

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie Chia Pudding {Gluten Free + Super Simple}
recipes.instructions: In a medium bowl, stir together the chia seeds, pumpkin pie spice, canned pumpkin and 1 Tbsp of the maple syrup. Pour in the milk and whisk together until well mixed. At this point, you can add more maple syrup if it's not sweet enough for you.Divide the pudding between 2 glasses and refrigerate overnight.To serve: Place the pecans into a small bowl, and pour in the remaining 1/2 tsp maple syrup. Use your fingers to stir around the pecans and make sure they get evenly coated in the syrup.Pour the pecans on a small plate and microwave until the syrup feels very sticky, and the pecans smell nutty, just about 1 minute. Let cool for 3-4 minutes, or until the maple syrup has hardened.Divide the pecans on top of the cups, sprinkle with a pinch of pumpkin pie spice and DEVOUR.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, stir together the chia seeds, pumpkin pie spice, canned pumpkin and 1 Tbsp of the maple syrup.

analyzedInstructions.name: Pour in the milk and whisk together until well mixed. At this point, you can add more maple syrup if it's not sweet enough for you.Divide the pudding between 2 glasses and refrigerate overnight.To serve

steps.step: Place the pecans into a small bowl, and pour in the remaining 1/2 tsp maple syrup. Use your fingers to stir around the pecans and make sure they get evenly coated in the syrup.
Pour the pecans on a small plate and microwave until the syrup feels very sticky, and the pecans smell nutty, just about 1 minute.
Let cool for 3-4 minutes, or until the maple syrup has hardened.Divide the pecans on top of the cups, sprinkle with a pinch of pumpkin pie spice and DEVOUR.
